completeness.description: The degree to which the solution addresses all aspects of the task

accepted_values.complete: All steps executed and question fully answered
accepted_values.partial: Some steps executed but question not fully answered
accepted_values.incomplete: Few or no steps executed and question not answered

correctness.description: The accuracy of the final answer provided by the agents

accepted_values.correct: The answer is accurate and correct
accepted_values.mostly_correct: The answer contains minor errors but is mostly correct
accepted_values.incorrect: The answer is incorrect or not relevant

efficiency.description: How effectively the agents use resources to achieve the task

accepted_values.optimal: Least amount of steps used to achieve the task
accepted_values.moderate: Reasonable amount of steps used, but could be optimized
accepted_values.inefficient: More steps than necessary, inefficient use of resources

reasoning_traceability.description: The ability to follow the reasoning process of the agents

accepted_values.transparent: Clear and detailed reasoning steps provided
accepted_values.opaque: Some reasoning steps provided, but not complete
accepted_values.untraceable: No reasoning steps provided, reasoning cannot be followed

originality.description: The uniqueness of the solution with no direct retrieval from existing databases

accepted_values.original: Solution crafted uniquely without direct copying
accepted_values.derivative: Solution based on existing information with some modification

response_time.description: The amount of time taken by the agents to complete the task

accepted_values.fast: Answer provided quickly within an acceptable timeframe
accepted_values.moderate: Answer provided in a moderate amount of time
